timeline.bodyText: Why is this piece of code exactly the same as above? timeline.bodyText: You should throw the same ParsingException if the name could not be extracted. I don't think "" would be handled correctly by the client, i.e. considering that the title could not be extracted
timeline.author: Stypox

timeline.bodyText: How can the thumbnail url be always the same if "My Mix" is different for everyone?
timeline.author: Stypox

replies.bodyText: Because the extractor is set up with a starting video (watch?v=videoId). The rest of the mix is indeed different for everyone, but because there is a starting video, the first one will always be that one.
replies.author: XiangRongLin

replies.bodyText: Oh, that's right, sorry ;-)

timeline.bodyText: When using YouTube's logo here, we can also use in other places. We should check legal stuff first. CC @TheAssassin
timeline.author: TobiGr

replies.bodyText: I think this should be handled differently in the frontend by not displaying an avatar. @Stypox, @wb9688 What do you think?
replies.author: TobiGr

replies.bodyText: IANAL. However, using any brand icons is a bad idea, and might get us into trouble. I don't think it's worth the effort. I haven't had a look whether the linked file would be fine copyright wise either.
replies.author: TheAssassin

replies.bodyText:
Ok, so either we put no avatar (which would probably look strange) or we choose an icon from https://material.io/icons that somewhat represents the nature of the playlist and the uploader. I thought of these icons:

Radio: 
Auto renew: 
Browser:
replies.author: Stypox

replies.bodyText: @XiangRongLin what do you think about this?
replies.author: Stypox

replies.bodyText:
I'm for either the Radio icon or no icon. Radio since the mix is basically a radio.
But that depends on which looks less out of place.
replies.author: XiangRongLin

replies.bodyText: whatever icons we use, that should be set in the app. It might be okay to return the URL to YouTube's logo in the extractor. However, it should be replaced in the frontend. Our extractor is used by other applications, too. They might want to use the original logo.
replies.author: TobiGr

replies.bodyText: Ok, that seems a good idea
replies.author: Stypox

replies.bodyText: I don't think we should return a link to YouTube's logo.
replies.author: wb9688

replies.bodyText: My vote goes to the Radio icon as well.
replies.author: opusforlife2

replies.bodyText:
Then i would be for returning a constant and each frontend can decide themself what they want to display based on the constant and legal stuff.
For NewPipe it would then be the radio icon.
replies.author: XiangRongLin

replies.bodyText:
We should not use the wikimedia image though. Here are the icons which are used on the website when the browser does not support SVG:
https://s.ytimg.com/yts/img/favicon_144-vfliLAfaB.png
https://s.ytimg.com/yts/img/favicon_96-vflW9Ec0w.png
https://s.ytimg.com/yts/img/favicon_48-vflVjB_Qk.png
https://s.ytimg.com/yts/img/favicon_32-vflOogEID.png

Then i would be for returning a constant and each frontend can decide themself what they want to display based on the constant and legal stuff.

@XiangRongLin What constant? Can you elaborate the idea? One can check whether the retrieved PlaylistInfo is a YTMix by using YouTubeParsingHelper.isYouTubeMixId(id)
replies.author: TobiGr

Nice finding the png, i somehow only found svg.

timeline.bodyText: && !playlistId.startsWith("RDAMVM"), so that it won't accept YouTube Music mixes. You'll also need to do that in the LinkHandler, so that NewPipe will open those as just a video until we implement YouTube Music mixes.
timeline.author: wb9688

timeline.bodyText: Why are you storing those as constants here? We don't do that anywhere else either…
timeline.author: wb9688

replies.bodyText: Because i would sometime make a typo in those strings and wonder for 10 minutes where my error was. With the constants i can let my IDE autocomplete for me.
replies.author: XiangRongLin

replies.bodyText: Please just follow the style of the rest of the extractors.
replies.author: wb9688

timeline.bodyText: You don't need to call collector.reset() here as every time you call it, you already have a new empty collector.
timeline.author: wb9688

timeline.bodyText: Why are you assigning playlistData again here? If you call getInitialPage() after that, it won't return the initial page.
timeline.author: wb9688

replies.bodyText:
Because i needed the updated playlistData for when getNextPageUrl() gets called multiple times.
I'just add a initialPlaylistData variable to the class
replies.author: XiangRongLin

replies.bodyText: getNextPageUrl() should always be relative to the initial page: https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipeExtractor/blob/dev/extractor/src/main/java/org/schabi/newpipe/extractor/ListExtractor.java#L30. Make a separate getNextPageUrlFrom() function like in the other extractors.
replies.author: wb9688

replies.bodyText: oh, I completly missed that. I'll fix it
replies.author: XiangRongLin

timeline.bodyText: You should call getUrlFromNavigationEndpoint() and just append &pbj=1. You'll first need to modify getUrlFromNavigationEndpoint() so that it handles the index parameter.
timeline.author: wb9688

replies.bodyText: I just saw that I already handled the index incorrectly, since i assumed the index in the url would count upwards. But it always stays at 25.
replies.author: XiangRongLin

replies.bodyText:
Is there a reason for using &amq; instead of just & since this is throwing a malformed url exception for me when i create new extractor with the return value of getUrlFromNavigationEndpoint()
https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipeExtractor/blob/dev/extractor/src/main/java/org/schabi/newpipe/extractor/services/youtube/linkHandler/YoutubeParsingHelper.java#L302
replies.author: XiangRongLin

replies.bodyText: Yes, there's a reason, but it's wrong. That function should return it with &, which should then be replaced with & at https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipeExtractor/blob/dev/extractor/src/main/java/org/schabi/newpipe/extractor/services/youtube/linkHandler/YoutubeParsingHelper.java#L319.
replies.author: wb9688

timeline.bodyText: Use assertTrue and assertFalse
timeline.author: wb9688

replies.bodyText: IMO that's okay. We can keep it
replies.author: TobiGr

timeline.bodyText: I still think getUrlFromNavigationEndpoint needs to put the index in the URL. You actually don't need to track it, you just need to do navigationEndpoint.getObject("watchEndpoint").getInt("index") + 1.
timeline.author: wb9688

replies.bodyText:
With tracking i mean the behaviour you get when you play a mix on youtube.com
If you always select the last video in the mix the index jumps from 1 to 25 to 49 to 50 and then stays at 50.
But the index value in watchEndpoint is always 24.
replies.author: XiangRongLin

replies.bodyText: I don't think so:
replies.author: wb9688

replies.bodyText:
Is that in the browser?
Since i couldn't get it to simulate that behaviour with the extractor
replies.author: XiangRongLin

replies.bodyText:
Yes, that's in Firefox. I'll try to reproduce.
Edit: it seems to have something to do with the cookies.
Edit 2: it's the VISITOR_INFO1_LIVE cookie.
Edit 3: I think you should leave it like you have it currently.

@@ -195,6 +202,26 @@ public static Calendar parseDateFrom(String textualUploadDate) throws ParsingExc
         return uploadDate;
     }
 
+    /**
+     * Checks if the given playlist id is a youtube mix (auto-generated playlist)
+     * Ids from a youtube mix start with "RD"
+     * @param playlistId
+     * @return Whether given id belongs to a youtube mix

+    public static boolean isYoutubeMixId(String playlistId) {
+        return playlistId.startsWith("RD") && !isYoutubeMusicMixId(playlistId);
+    }
+
+    /**

timeline.message: [Youtube] Apply review suggestions and avoid channel mix edge case

[Youtube] Implement mix extractor for auto-generated playlists.

-New YoutubeMixPlaylistExtractor, that extracts from a mix (auto-generated playlist).
-The url has the format of "youtube.com/watch?v=videoID&playlistID",
where playlistID always starts with "RD" and usually followed by the videoID.
-Change YoutubePlaylistLinkHandlerFactory to create a linkhandler with the given url if it is a mix.
-Change YoutubeService to return YoutubeMixPlaylistExtractor if the url is a mix.
[Youtube] Extract getThumbnailUrl into method and change getUploaderName
[Youtube] Add some comments to mix

[Youtube] Handle case where url is in "youtube.com/playlist?list=listID" format.

This occurs when sharing a mix from the official youtube app.
[Youtube] Extract initial playlist info

[Youtube] Adjust mix extractor to new user agent

Also extract continuation now
[Youtube] Fix get banner url

[Youtube] Add tests and take thumbnail image always from first video of mix

Also fix getThumbnailUrl for "My Mix"

[Youtube] Add _ITEMS constants and improve code style

Move thumbnail id exctraction code to getThumbnailUrlFromId
Add test for "My mix" detection to service tests
Use ITEM_COUNT_UNKNOWN everywhere instead of -1 and add some tests

[Youtube] apply wb9688 suggestion (mix)

Channel mix adjusments and test
Don't accept youtube music mix urls as playlist
Don't override playlistData to keep getInitialPage()
Remove json constants
Indentation
[Youtube] Add subchannel functions to mix and fix imports

[Youtube] Add cookies to youtube mix request

This way youtube wont return duplicates when getting more items of the mix (but youtube can also track us)
[Youtube] Apply review suggestions and avoid channel mix edge case
[YouTube] Don't escape & in getUrlFromNavigationEndpoint for playlists
[YouTube] Don't escape & in getUrlFromNavigationEndpoint for playlists
